intro: Diporidium macowanii, commonly known as the Macowan's diporidium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
